src:
Fuzhou China Open 2019 : Sedih, Gregoria Terhenti
07 Nov 2019, 10:44 by Danang Sundoro


Fuzhou China Open 2019 : Sedih, Gregoria Terhenti

KBRN, Fuzhou : Tunggal Putri Indonesia, Gregoria Mariska Tunjung terhenti di babak kedua Turnamen  Bulutangkis Fuzhou China Open 2019 di Haixia, Olympic Sports Center, Kamis (7/11/2019) pagi.Pebulutangkis putri Indonesia, Gregoria Mariska lagi-lagi harus mengakui keunggulan Tai Tzu Ying, pemain andalan Taiwan yang kini duduk di peringkat dua dunia dengan skor 19-21, 17-21.“Penampilan saya masih sama, masih belum ada perubahan. Selalu seperti itu, sudah unggul, masih buru-buru mau mematikan. Tadi poinnya memang mepet, tapi saya merasa keteteran sekali, saya sering berada di posisi yang tidak menguntungkan untuk mengembalikan bola dengan baik,” ungkap Gregoria, usai laga dalam keterangan tertulis kepada Radio Republik Indonesia (RRI), Kamis (7/11/2019).“Cara main saya bikin saya susah sendiri. Tadi banyak mati sendiri, pola main dan strateginya pun tidak jalan. Sebetulnya lawan itu pola mainnya lambat, kalau mau saya cepetin pun nggak menguntungkan buat diri saya sendiri,” lanjutnya.“Bukan cuma non teknik seperti ketenangan, dari segi teknik, saya juga harus menambah latihan dari segi variasi pukulan dan tidak boleh monoton. Jadinya malah cocok-cocokan kalau ketemu lawan, padahal harusnya pemain bagus itu punya pola untuk tiap lawan yang berbeda,” ujar Gregoria.Dengan hasil ini maka sektor tunggal putri Indonesia belum berhasil mengirim wakil ke babak perempat final turnamen level super 750 ini. Fitriani sudah lebih dulu terhenti di babak pertama usai dikalahkan Nitchaon Jindapol (Thailand), dengan skor 12-21, 11-21. Hingga berita ini diturunkan, para pebulutangkis Indonesia masih berjuang pada pertandingan babak kedua Fuzhou China Open 2019. (Keterangan Foto : PP.PBSI)
text:
Fuzhou China Open 2019: Sad, Gregoria Stopped
Nov 7 2019, 10:44 by Danang Sundoro


Fuzhou China Open 2019: Sad, Gregoria Stopped

KBRN, Fuzhou: Indonesian Women's Singles, Gregoria Mariska Tunjung stopped in the second round of the Fuzhou China Open 2019 Badminton Tournament at Haixia, Olympic Sports Center, Thursday (11/07/2019) morning. Indonesian women's badminton player, Gregoria Mariska, must again recognize the advantages Tai Tzu Ying, Taiwan's flagship player who currently sits in the world number two with a score of 19-21, 17-21. "My appearance is still the same, there is still no change. Always like that, already superior, still in a hurry want to turn off. "The point was indeed tight, but I feel very strict, I am often in an unfavorable position to return the ball well," said Gregoria, after the match in a written statement to Radio Republik Indonesia (RRI), Thursday (11/07/2019) "The way I play makes me difficult myself. Earlier many died alone, the pattern of play and strategy did not work. Actually the opponent's playing pattern is slow, if I want to say it won't even benefit myself, "he continued." Not just non-technical things like calm, from a technical point of view, I also have to add training in terms of variations of blows and shouldn't be monotonous. It makes it a good match to meet an opponent, even though a good player should have a pattern for each different opponent, "said Gregoria. With these results, the Indonesian women's singles sector has not succeeded in sending representatives to the quarter-finals of the 750 super level tournament. Fitriani had already stopped in the first round after being defeated by Nitchaon Jindapol (Thailand), with a score of 12-21, 11-21. Until this news was revealed, Indonesian badminton players were still fighting in the second round match of the Fuzhou China Open 2019. (Photo Caption: PP.PBSI)
